results.title: Le Beau mariage = A Good marriage
results.creator_credit: Margaret Menegoz, Eric Rohmer, Les Films du Carrosse and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Comedies et proverbes”.
Eric Rohmer takes a proverb from La Fontaine as his guiding principle in this, the second of his “Comedies et proverbes”. “Can any of us refrain, from building castles in Spain?” - the castles in Spain, in this instance being the dream of an ideal marriage, which the heroine Sabine pursues in the form of the unwilling Edmond, a lawyer introduced to her by her matchmaking friend. An acutely observed portrait of pain and humiliation, made palatable by Rohmer’s deft handling of the lighter as well as the darker side of human frailty. Beatrice Romand won the Best Actress award at the 1981 Venice Film Festival for her portrayal of the paradoxical Sabine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margaret Menegoz, Eric Rohmer, Les Films du Carrosse and Les Films du Losange

results.title: Le Battant = the Cache
results.creator_credit: Adel Productions, AMLF and Alain Delon
results.brief_description:
As soon as he is released from jail, Jacques Darnay is being followed by Commissioner Rouxel. Darnay has spent 5 years inside for a jewellery heist and Rouxel hopes Darnay is going to lead him to the cache.

Credits: Producer, director, Alain Delon ; writers, Alain Delon, Christopher Frank ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Christian Dorisse, Michel Colombier.
Cast: Alain Delon, Francois Perier, Pierre Mondy, Anne Parillaud, Andrea Ferreol, Jean-Francois Garreaud, Richard Anconina, Michel Beaune.

results.title: Le Bal du Regent = the Regent's Ball
results.brief_description:
Episode 3 of Series “Lagardere”.
Aurore has moved in with Suzanne, Lagardere’s old nanny, to try and avoid the spies sent by Philippe de Gonzague. Henri is trying to track down Blanche, Aurore’s mother. Little does he know that she is now married to Philippe de Gonzague. Gonzague has devised a scheme to introduce to Blanche a young orphan named Flor who is to pass for Aurore.

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin, Dominique Paturel.

results.title: Le 5eme Dessous
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
The children are taken by force by Lulu and led underneath the Opera House. Lulu demands to be taken to the props department and the jewels. The Police is searching the whole House.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Le-haut sur ces montagnes
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chants populaires”.
Animated interpretation of the French folk song “La-haut sur ces Montagnes” set on the island of Orleans near Quebec, where traditional dances and songs are kept alive by the peasant community. Featuring Madeleine Lachance and the Quatuor Alouette.

results.title: Lazy Sunday afternoon
results.brief_description: In the desert a vulture enjoys the silence of a hot afternoon. The sudden appearance of a vehicle destroys the quiet of the day. Two pistoleros exit the car ready for a duel; our hero, the vulture, watches as the pistoleros take part in a very funny slow motion shoot-out.

results.title: Layout and handling in factories
results.brief_description: The effect on production costs, time and workers’ well-being of imperfect factory layout. Various examples show that regrouping of existing equipment and the addition of new can significantly increase productivity and repay capital outlay.

results.title: Laying it on the line
results.creator_credit: R and R Productions, Victorian Film Corporation and Ron V. Brown
results.brief_description: Gives a general overview of the method of planning excavation, laying and testing of two types of drainage materials - stoneware and PVC pipes. The need for correct installation methods current with present procedures are clearly shown.
